channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: How changes to a CDC vaccine panel under Kennedy could reshape policy
item.description: A committee of experts that advises the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention is critical in setting national vaccine policy. It's also vulnerable to political interference.
item.content:encoded:
A committee of experts that advises the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention is critical in setting national vaccine policy. It's also vulnerable to political interference.

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)
item.dc:creator: Pien Huang

item.title: Trump's spending cuts target probationary workers. What does the status mean?
item.description: As the Trump administration carries out mass firings of the federal workforce in a push to slash government spending, its targeting probationary workers. Here's what to know about the employee status.
item.content:encoded:
As the Trump administration carries out mass firings of the federal workforce in a push to slash government spending, its targeting probationary workers. Here's what to know about the employee status.

(Image credit: Mark Schiefelbein)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: Courts block Trump's DOGE actions â€” chaos, panic not proving to be best legal strategy
item.description: Some legal scholars say that the administration is bungling the chance to expand presidential power.
item.content:encoded:
Some legal scholars say that the administration is bungling the chance to expand presidential power.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Chris Arnold

item.title: After Watergate, Congress curbed the presidency. Now, Trump is testing those limits
item.description: President Trump's efforts to cut federal programs and fire watchdogs are drawing attention to 1970s-era government reforms.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump's efforts to cut federal programs and fire watchdogs are drawing attention to 1970s-era government reforms.

(Image credit: File)
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: Are immigrants still welcome in Mayor Eric Adams' New York City? We asked New Yorkers.
item.description: New York City's mayor has embraced a more conservative, less immigrant friendly stance. What does that mean for a city that's built it's identity on immigration?
item.content:encoded:
New York City's mayor has embraced a more conservative, less immigrant friendly stance. What does that mean for a city that's built it's identity on immigration?

(Image credit: Marco Postigo Storel)
item.dc:creator: Jasmine Garsd

item.title: Trump officials signal potential changes at NOAA, the weather and climate agency
item.description: Federal workers at the home agency for the National Weather Service are concerned about a potential overhaul by Trump officials focused on cutting government costs.
item.content:encoded:
Federal workers at the home agency for the National Weather Service are concerned about a potential overhaul by Trump officials focused on cutting government costs.

(Image credit: Joe Raedle/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Alejandra Borunda

item.title: Hamas releases three Israeli hostages, the sixth group freed under a ceasefire deal
item.description: In a ceremony surrounded by masked Palestinian militants and rubble from the Gaza war, Hamas released three Israeli hostages holding U.S., Russian and Argentinian citizenships on Saturday.
item.content:encoded:
In a ceremony surrounded by masked Palestinian militants and rubble from the Gaza war, Hamas released three Israeli hostages holding U.S., Russian and Argentinian citizenships on Saturday.

(Image credit: Bashar Taleb)
item.dc:creator: Hadeel Al-Shalchi

item.title: A Valentine's weekend aurora may be visible in the skies of the northern U.S.
item.description: During Valentine's Day weekend, northern parts of America, including Maine, may have a chance of seeing an aurora. But space weather scientists warn that the chances of this happening are slim.
item.content:encoded:
During Valentine's Day weekend, northern parts of America, including Maine, may have a chance of seeing an aurora. But space weather scientists warn that the chances of this happening are slim.

(Image credit: Michael Seamans)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: Federal judge blocks CFPB from laying off more employees
item.description: The ruling from a federal court in Washington, D.C., is a reprieve for CFPB staff who had been bracing for mass layoffs as early as Friday.
item.content:encoded:
The ruling from a federal court in Washington, D.C., is a reprieve for CFPB staff who had been bracing for mass layoffs as early as Friday.

(Image credit: Saul Loeb)
item.dc:creator: Laurel Wamsley

item.title: Trump firings cause chaos at agency responsible for America's nuclear weapons
item.description: The National Nuclear Security Administration is a semi-autonomous agency within the Department of Energy that oversees the U.S. stockpile of thousands of nuclear weapons. Officials were given hours to fire hundreds of employees.
item.content:encoded: The National Nuclear Security Administration is a semi-autonomous agency within the Department of Energy that oversees the U.S. stockpile of thousands of nuclear weapons. Officials were given hours to fire hundreds of employees.
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel
